item.title: 【Success Case】Delinquent Tenant Missing and Behind on Rent? Attorney Assists with Compulsory Execution to Successfully Reclaim Property
item.author: email@example.com (Author Name)
item.dc:creator: A-Bo-Bo Attorney at Law
item.description: The tenant fell behind on rent for over six months and avoided all contact. The attorney obtained a favorable judgment through litigation and applied for compulsory execution, successfully completing the property handover.
item.content:encoded:
Case Overview

The client, Mr. Chen (pseudonym), leased an apartment in Taipei City to a tenant. Initially, rent was paid on time; however, after six months, the tenant began using excuses to delay payments and eventually stopped answering calls and messages. The total rent arrears exceeded six months.

Mr. Chen attempted to resolve the issue in person but found the door locked. Worried that changing the locks himself might violate laws regarding “Coercion” or “Trespassing,” leaving him helpless against the squatter, he entrusted our firm to handle the matter.

Legal Strategy & Proceedings

Step 1: Issuing a Formal Demand Letter (Termination of Contract)

Legal procedures rely on evidence. Attorney A-Bo-Bo first assisted in sending a “Formal Demand Letter” (Legal Notice), setting a reasonable deadline for the tenant to pay the arrears. Once the deadline passed, we issued a notice to “Terminate the Lease Agreement” in accordance with Article 440 of the Civil Code, effectively stripping the tenant of their legal right to possession.

Step 2: Filing a Lawsuit for Eviction and Recovery of Premises

As the tenant continued to ignore the situation, we immediately filed a lawsuit for “Eviction and Recovery of Premises” and “Payment of Rent Arrears.” In court, the attorney presented the complete lease agreement, remittance records, and the return receipt of the formal demand letter. After review, the judge swiftly rendered a favorable judgment for Mr. Chen.

Step 3: Application for Compulsory Execution

Despite the judgment, the tenant refused to vacate. The attorney immediately applied to the Civil Execution Department of the Court for “Compulsory Execution.” Accompanied by a Court Clerk and local police officers, a locksmith was called to open the door. After an inventory of the items inside, the tenant’s possession was officially terminated, and the property was formally handed back to Mr. Chen.

// Case Timeline
January: Issued Formal Demand Letter for arrears.
February: Formally filed the lawsuit.
May: Obtained favorable judgment (Judgment by Default/One-Sided Argument).
July: On-site Compulsory Execution and Property Handover.

item.title: 【Success Case】Defrauded of NT$2 Million by Fake LINE Investment Group; Attorney Assists in Full Recovery
item.author: email@example.com (Author Name)
item.dc:creator: A-Bo-Bo Attorney at Law
item.description: The client fell victim to a fraudulent investment scheme. Our firm assisted in freezing the designated 'Alert Accounts' and successfully negotiated with the syndicate members for full compensation of losses.
item.content:encoded:
Case Overview

The client, Mr. Lin (pseudonym), saw an advertisement on Facebook for “Free AI Stock Market Tutorials.” After joining a LINE group, he was brainwashed by the persuasive tactics of the group’s “Teacher” and “Teaching Assistant.” Believing them implicitly, Mr. Lin gradually transferred his retirement savings—totaling NT$2 million—into a “trading platform app” specified by the fraud syndicate.

Initially, the account showed staggering profits. However, when Mr. Lin attempted to withdraw his funds, the platform’s customer service created various obstacles, citing “security deposits” and “tax issues.” Eventually, Mr. Lin was kicked out of the group. Realizing he had been scammed, he urgently sought assistance from Attorney A-Bo-Bo.

Red Flags of the Scam:

  1. Guarantees of high returns with zero risk.
  2. Operations conducted via unknown apps or URLs.
  3. Requirements to transfer more money when attempting to withdraw funds.

Legal Strategy & Proceedings

Step 1: Emergency Stop-Payment and Police Report

Upon being retained, Attorney A-Bo-Bo immediately assisted in organizing remittance records and chat screenshots. We guided the client to file a report at the police station and simultaneously notified the bank for an “Emergency Stop-Payment (Circle Deposit).” We successfully had the syndicate’s mule accounts designated as “Alert Accounts,” freezing a portion of the funds.

Step 2: Defense in Criminal Investigation Hearings

Once the case reached the District Prosecutors Office, although the masterminds (overseas call centers) were difficult to track, we successfully identified the “Money Mules” and “Nominee Account Holders” who provided the accounts. During the investigation hearings, the attorney strongly asserted that the defendants should be held criminally liable for “Aiding and Abetting Fraud” and “Money Laundering,” exerting significant psychological pressure on the defendants.

Step 3: Mediation and Compensation

Under the attorney’s negotiation strategy, the defendants agreed to enter mediation with the victim to seek a suspended sentence or a lighter penalty.

// Negotiation Highlights
Attorney's Argument: If no compensation is paid, we will pursue criminal charges and supplementary civil claims. The defendants would face imprisonment while still being liable for the debt.
Outcome: The defendants agreed to a settlement to compensate Mr. Lin's losses in installments.
